summary:

projects.title: Children's Educational Empowerment Project
projects.description:
It was a project carried out during my Youth service in Lagos. During the period i served under the umbrella of MDGs as a mentor in  Opebi Primary School were i took on the pupils in primary 4 to 6.

The children, after being taught some self awareness lessons and their civic responsibilities towards themselves and their society, they were futher empowered to enable them retain and maintain the new standards they have been taught.

This was done by providing them with necessary school items to aid their learning experience and also to assist their parents who barely have enough.

volunteer_experiences.description:
As one of the facilitators, we held weekend-based programs for Project Professionals and those intending to enrol for the classes. The exercise involved seminar classes for each of the Project Management fields. Attendees were awarded certificates of attendance at the end of each seminar. 

It was quite challenging and in all a learning process. I would do it again given another opportunity.

Researched and developed content on MECA business plan project

Worked with a team on developing a prominent Nigerian's biography published on Wikipedia

Researched and developed contents on goal #1 of the SDGs for development partners

Worked with a team to develop a business plan proposal for Bank of Industry grant

Worked with a team on researching and developing content on the topic "Nigeria From A Side Mirror: Packing out of Recession". We researched and wrote on the following themes: Theme 1 - The success of the Nigerian woman: Nigeria's way out of Recession; Theme 2 - The Impact of Non-collar Jobs on a Nigerian Economy - as a follow up to this topic we went out to the street to conduct live interviews with small business owners in the non-collar job sector. This was uploaded on the social media.

Advocated for girls to go to school rather than be married off due to poverty situations in their family.

Gave my voice to stop child marriage in IDP camps due to insurgency and poverty.

Helped to empower girls to go to school and not be turned into baby makers at an early age.

Ensured that a girl's sexual and reproductive health was protected and not jeopardized with early marriage.

Helped a girl's dream to achieve formal education come through.
